intro: Gilibertia sessiliflora, commonly known as the red sand mat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of South America. It features a mat-forming growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that are typically reddish in color. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its root system is adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Gilibertia sessiliflora is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
